Class MetaSearch

  • java.lang.Object
    • assignment4.MetaSearch

  • public class MetaSearch
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that models a search engine and shopping cart

      • addProducts

        public static void addProducts(java.lang.String[] userInput)
        Adds a product that the user enters to the end of the list of products
        Parameters:
        userInput - The information that the user entered into the GUI

      • getErrorMessages

        public static java.lang.String getErrorMessages(java.lang.String error)
        Finds the appropriate error message for the given exception
        Parameters:
        error - A String that is the exact error message contained within the exception that was thrown
        Returns:
        A string that contains more information about the error that occurred

      • searchForProducts

        public static void searchForProducts(java.lang.String[] searchParameters)
        Searches the list of products for particular products based on keyword(s) that the user enters. It only prints the products that contain ALL of the entered keywords.
        Parameters:
        searchParameters - All of the information that the user has input (from GUI.getSearchParameters())

      • hashMapEntriesMatches

        public static java.lang.String hashMapEntriesMatches(java.lang.String[] mediaTypes,
                                     java.lang.String[] titleKeywords,
                                     Date bottomRange,
                                     Date topRange)
        Finds prints all entries that match the entered parameters by finding matching title keywords using a hash map. It prints the toString method of any matching entries to the screen (System.out).
        Parameters:
        mediaTypes - They types of products that the user wishes to search for
        titleKeywords - The keywords that the user wishes to find in the title - ALL MUST MATCH to be considered a matching product
        bottomRange - The date after which we want the release date of the product to be
        topRange - The date before which we want the release date of the product to be
        Returns:
        False if NONE of the products matched the search parameters, True otherwise

      • getTitleIndexes

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getTitleIndexes(java.lang.String[] keywords)
        Finds all of the the indexes of the products in the products ArrayList whose titles match all of the user's keywords
        Parameters:
        keywords - the keywords that the user would like to search for
        Returns:
        null if the user entered no keywords (would like no restrictions on the title), Otherwise the ArrayList containing the indexes of all of the products in the products ArrayList that match ALL of the user's keywords

      • combineArrayLists

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> combineArrayLists(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> first,
                                                       java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> second)
        Combines the intersection two ArraryLists of Integers into one ArrayList of Integers
        Parameters:
        first - The first ArrayList of Integers
        second - The Second ArrayList of Integers
        Returns:
        An ArrayList that contains all of the common elements of the two ArrayLists

      • typesMatch

        public static boolean typesMatch(Entry nextProduct,
                 java.lang.String[] mediaTypes)
        Checks to see if the nextProduct's class matches one of the media types that the user is searching for
        Parameters:
        nextProduct - The product whose class we wish to compare
        mediaTypes - The String array of all of the user's chosen media types
        Returns:
        True if the mediaTypes is an empty string (no restrictions on the class of the object) or one of the user's entered media types matches the class of the current object. Otherwise, false.

      • keywordsMatch

        public static boolean keywordsMatch(java.lang.String keyword,
                    java.lang.String[] userInput)
        Checks if any of the tokens that the user has input matches the comparison String
        Parameters:
        keyword - The String that we want to find a match to
        userInput - The tokens that the user has entered as an array of strings
        Returns:
        True if AT LEAST one of the user's tokens matches the comparison String, false otherwise

      • allKeywordsMatch

        public static boolean allKeywordsMatch(java.lang.String[] keywords,
                       java.lang.String[] comparison)
        Checks if every keyword of user input matches a string in the comparison String
        Parameters:
        keywords - The keywords that we wish to find matches for
        comparison - The string array that we want to find the keywords in
        Returns:
        True if ALL of the keywords have been found in the comparison String, false otherwise

      • withinDateRange

        public static boolean withinDateRange(Date releaseDate,
                      Date bottom,
                      Date top)
        Checks if a release date is within the desired date range. if any of the last two parameters are null, then there is no bound on that side of the range
        Parameters:
        releaseDate - The Date object that contains the day that the product was released
        bottom - The lower bound for the date range. All dates after, but after top are accepted
        top - The upper bound for the date range. All dates before, but not before bottom are accepted
        Returns:
        True if the release date lies within the range that was input, false otherwise

      • getInternetInformation

        public static java.lang.String getInternetInformation(java.lang.String[] mediaTypes,
                                      java.lang.String[] titleKeywords,
                                      Date bottomRange,
                                      Date topRange)
        Adds up to 12 products from chapters.ca to our products ArrayList based on the restrictions that the user has entered
        Parameters:
        mediaTypes - The specific type of entries that the user is searching for (eg. book, movie)
        titleKeywords - The words that must be in the title of the product
        bottomRange - The lower bound for the release date range of the product
        topRange - The upper bound for the release date range of the product
        Returns:
        A string containing all of the matching entries from the Internet or an error message depending on what went wrong

      • parseWebpage

        public static java.lang.String parseWebpage(java.lang.String webPage,
                            java.lang.String mediaType,
                            Date bottomRange,
                            Date topRange)
        Searches the webSite chapters.ca for up to 12 products. It will then add any product that matches the user's input criteria to the products ArrayList and indexes hashMap
        Parameters:
        webPage - The entire contents of the webPage that contains our search results (the HTML source code)
        mediaType - The media types that the user wishes to find
        bottomRange - The date after which we want the release date of the product to be
        topRange - The date before which we want the release date of the product to be
        Returns:
        The number of products in our search results from chapters.ca that matched all of the user's criteria

      • writeProductsToFile

        public static void writeProductsToFile()
        Writes all of the Entries in our current collection into the file "productsList.txt" It then updates both text areas of the GUI with the results of the write (whether it was successful or not)

      • loadProductsFromFile

        public static void loadProductsFromFile()
        Adds all of the Entries in a file to our products list (and updates our hash map) NOTE - the file that you are reading the entries in from must have been created using the above method (writeProductsToFile())

      • clearProductsList

        public static void clearProductsList()
        Clears all products in your products list
